iati-activity.title: Shea Policy and Practice Improvement in Ghana
iati-activity.description: This project contributes to SCO 1 and will see women producers of shea kernel and shea butter in the three northern regions of Ghana collectively influencing government policy and practice to provide better investment and protection of their livelihood. The policies requiring improvement relate to long -term livelihood security issues securing the appropriate management of shea trees, limited investment and protection from the government into the shea sector in comparison to cocoa and the lack of exclusive policies that support women's economic position with the shea production cycle.

iati-activity.title: Enhancing Livelihood Security through Climate Adaptation Learning in Ghana
iati-activity.description: The project is an initial 12 -month pilot seeking to work with four partners in 8 communities focused on enhancing livelihoods security through climate change adaptation and learning. Specific actions will include: promoting soil and water conservation; protection of natural vegetation; promoting dry season gardening; awareness raising on climate change adaptation as well as advocacy to support communities to engage in pro -poor climate change adaptation policies.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Enhancing Programme Quality, Gender Justice, Accountability & Learning in Ghana
iati-activity.description: This project provides for programme development and management, gender justice, accountability (partnership, monitoring & evaluation) and learning activities to support the wider country programme objectives of improving sustainable livelihoods and access to essential services for women and men in resource poor regions of Ghana. It covers staff costs and overheads as well as programme coordination involving all partners. This project will ensure coherence between partner plans and overall programme objectives; and effective monitoring of progress against the Country JCAS via regular monitoring reviews and impact assessment activities.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: improving Maternal and child health in Upper East Ghana
iati-activity.description: The Interventions include training TBAs and CHCs to fit them within the referral chain, also to skilfully deliver cases where midwives are obviously absent. They are also trained to identify maternal complications, using mobile technology to connect remote communities to health personnel, and educating and raising the awareness of women about the governments free maternal health policy.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Emergency WASH Response in Ghana
iati-activity.description: Intervention will primarily target refugees who are living in refugee camps (Approximately 5,000 beneficiaries ) of Fatenta and Ejirikrum and Ampain transit sites. The project aims to provide water and sanitatrion facilities as well as hygiene promotion in the target communities.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Advocacy for Improved Policy and Investment on Smallholder Agriculture in Ghana
iati-activity.description: The project aims to ensure more women and men small -scale food producers have stronger voice in food and agriculture policy processes and rights to productive assets and market opportunities for sustainable and dignified lives. This project will support CSOs and farmers to collectively influence policy and practice for better investment and protection of their livelihood. The policies requiring improvement relate to food security, land management, investment and protection of smallholder agriculture and the lack of exclusive policies that support women's economic position
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Oil 4 Food - Using Ghana's oil to feed Ghana's people
iati-activity.description: Oxfam and partners will run a two month campaign to ensure that support for small -scale farmers is prioritised by the Government in its allocation of oil and gas revenues. The campaign will bring together partners from the extractive industries campaign (led by OA) and the GROW Campaign (led by OGB), as well as innovators in Ghanaian social media. A central part of the campaign will be a mobile phone petition promoted in universities, newspapers, radio etc, complemented by â€˜thumbprint' petitions in farming communities where literacy is low, and online petitions.

iati-activity.title: Advocacy for Ghana SADA Policy and Practice Improvement
iati-activity.description: The project aims at encouraging and facilitating the direct participation of women and men living with or threatened by poverty and hunger in the decision -making processes that affect their right to development by reinforcing civil society capacities for engaging in Northern Savannah Accelerated Development Authority (SADA)/agric related policy making and implementation at local and national levels. The project also aims at building relationship with national civil society and INGOs, working in the Savannah zone of Ghana, with the aim to using the learning experience to develop longer -term agriculture governance and accountability project.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Commitment to Free Health Care for the Poor Advocacy Project - Ghana
iati-activity.description: This project is Ghana's entry project into health within Ghana. With government plans to make a one time premium payment for users of the insurance scheme a reality, doubts have been raised by donors and some members of the public in terms of its financial feasibility. The advocacy approaches used advance the debate on the one time premium payment, by demonstrating to those who question the financial feasibility the options and benefits such a change will bring. The project will also build the relationship with national NGO's, with the aim to develop longer term projects together.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Food and Agriculture Recovery Management, Ghana- FARM +
iati-activity.description: This is a 20 -month project implemented in collaboration with CARE International. The project aims to improve the food security situation of 9000 food insecure households in 200 poor communities across five districts in Northern Ghana. The project works with 5 national partners, farmers, community leaders, government, and parliament on policy reforms for increased investment and support to food insecure areas and households. The project involves direct intervention focused on food for work for food insecure households, and advocacy around facilitating engagement of small -scale farmers with agric and food security governance processes in Ghana.
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Campaign for Universal Access to quality Healthcare in Ghana
iati-activity.description: Conduct a research on universal access to health care in Ghana, Capacity building for partners and media for improved skills in advocacy and campaigning on universal access to free health care.Facilitate growth and linkage with Networks and alliances in health care and dialogue with policy makers, and Facilitating linkage between the Ghana health care campaign and the global ES campaign
iati-activity.sector: Right to Equity: Gender and Diversity

iati-activity.title: Universal Health Care Campaign in Ghana
iati-activity.description: This project aims to support and strengthen existing national campaigns and advocacy on Universal Access to Health Care Campaign (UHCC) in Ghana. This will be achieved through awareness raising on the limitations of the current National Health Insurance Scheme (NHIS) as a model for financing health care and advocate for its replacement as well as public and political awareness on, and support for UHCC. Awareness will also be raised on the need to scale up and improve service delivery especially in under -served areas. The Campaign will sensitise civil society in Ghana on the ongoing consultations on the post MDG framework.

iati-activity.title: Ghana Maternal Health Transitional Project
iati-activity.description: Organise pregnancy schools in 6 communities, Provide bi -monthly airtime credit for mobile phones ( 6 months), Install four water points to project community clinics without water, Refresher training for 200 TBAs in basic maternal care, identifying complications and making quick referrals
